page.title: 01FEATURES OF OUR AREA
page.content: Landscape and buildings include a village hall which is well equiped with toilets a stage and kitchen as well as general rooms. There is a 4 acre playing field attached to the village hall which is owned by the villagers. This includes a childrens' playground. There are manor houses at both Marston and Hougham. The only public house in the area is in Marston, a free house called "Thorold Arms". Religion is catered for by two C.of E. churches; St.Mary's Marston and All Saints Hougham. The River Witham flows through the area but is unnavigable at this point. Transport in the area is represented by the main railway link between London and Edinburgh although the local station has closed.
